reviews.review_msg: This material in this class is unclear and the amount of time set for the exams too short. Inconsistent marking, double check every assignment. Lectures are full of unnecessary information. Only need the text book for the tables at the back. Take your time on the assignments and rush through the exams.

(For SA355) Dr. Watson breaks down tough concepts very well, gives super clear grading criteria, and is amazing about giving thorough feedback on assignments. The only issue I had is with the textbook; she's so thorough in lectures that you can do well without buying the expensive book - but you need it for lab questions. Otherwise, no issues!

Quantitative research is not an easy thing to learn, let alone teach, so I give props to her for doing it so well. Asynchronous lectures were highly useful. If you have a background studying SOC, you will understand how to put the data together. Overall really great experience - I'm bummed she's not teaching the 300 level of this next semester!
Very clear instructions and helpful when students had questions. Really friendly and great sense of humour!

-Class asynchronous, no attendance, work lab due every week.
- She doesn't really explain the material, rather just shows you where to click to make tables and graph appears   
-She isn't very helpful if you reach out 
- Gives good feedback on your lab
-Can do less than 1h/week if ur okay with a C
